import React from "react"; import address from "../image/OutlayrAddress.PNG"; import address2 from "../image/OutlayrAddress2.PNG"; import campaigns from "../image/OutlayrCampaigns.PNG"; import campaigns2 from "../image/OutlayrCampaigns2.PNG"; import login from "../image/WorkoutLogin.PNG"; import register from "../image/WorkoutRegister.PNG"; import workout from "../image/WorkoutUser.PNG"; import workout2 from "../image/WorkoutTable.PNG"; import crypto from "../image/CryptoLeft.PNG"; import crypto2 from "../image/CoinMarketCap.PNG"; // import crypto2 from "../image/OutlayrRatingWide.png"; // import joesdough1 from "../image/JoesDough1.png"; // import joesdough2 from "../image/JoesDough2.png"; // import joesdough3 from "../image/JoesDough2Full.png"; // import joesdough4 from "../image/JoesDough3Full.png"; // import personal1 from "../image/personalFull.jpg"; // import personal2 from "../image/personal_project2.png"; // import personal3 from "../image/personal_project3.png"; // import personal4 from "../image/personalFull1.jpg"; class MyWork extends React.Component { componentDidMount() { console.log("hello"); let textOverImage = document.querySelectorAll(".details"); for (let i = 0; i < textOverImage.length; i++) { textOverImage[i].onclick = function() { console.log(this.classList); this.classList.toggle("show"); }; } } render() { return (

My Work

Here is a dashboard of my previous projects. Click on the pictures to see more information!

Address List

Developed an address list of all merchants, influencers, and customers with SQL Server as database, .Net Core (C#) as the server side, and React (Javascript) for front end development for client.

  • The address list is editable and displays a modal when editing.
  • Addresses are deletable and uses shallow React comparisons in order to prevent unwanted rerendering of the whole component.

Campaigns

Developed a list of campaigns that merchants and influencers have participated and is participating in.

  • Edit and deletion of campaigns are also configured to use shallow React comparisons to prevent unwanted rerednering of whole component and page.

Discount Dropdown in Campaign

Improved Campaign Component allowing users to navigate through the application easier.

  • Added discount dropdown that depending on the product selected, it will show the discounts associated with the product through writing complex stored procedure/algorithm in T-SQL and React.
  • Updated Campaign Component by linking tables in T-Sql and writing queries to show product/discount names instead of corresponding Ids.

Topping and Pizza Display Page

  • Structured the data of Topping and Pizza entities in seperate tables and connected through a compositite table with pizza id and topping id. I made the two id into foreign keys.
  • In order to get the pizza with all the necessary toppings, I wrote a stored procedure that made two select queries wrapped in a transaction statment -- one getting all the pizza and one getting all pizza id and topping id from the composite table. Through C#, I stitched the result set using IDictionary interface and displayed the approprate information.{" "} See Code Here
  • Implemented Edit and Delete functionality.

Adding Toppings

  • A modal appears with the available toppings to add to the pizza.
  • The done button is disabled if no topping is added.

Adding Toppings

  • Once the topping is added, the topping is removed from the dropdown.
  • Using CSS animation the topping is shown on the pizza.
); } } export default MyWork;
